result.execSummary:
The defendant Sam J Lestina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with co-defendants or any known drug users/dealers.

Not to be present where controlled substances are sold or used.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Credit for 225 days if probation revoked.

The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both.
.

records.addlTxt: PO Jody Douglas

Def in custody w/atty Schwartz
  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
  Statement as to Neg. Plea filed
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Ct1: Def pleads guilty
CRT: sentence withheld 3 years probation w/cond: AODA & comply, no alcohol or CS w/random testing, no contact w/co-def or any known drug users dealers or locations where drugs are present or sold, obtain/maintain full time employment/education, any other eval's left up to PO, pay CC + DOC Supervision fees, credit for 225 days if probation revoked
From: Atty Schwartz Re: Witness Demand Motion is intended to be Witness list

from  Atty Paul Schwartz   re: request for Bail/Bond Hrg 
Per SLH:  Please set - Telephonec Conference is OK

9:15 AM - Def in court, in custody with Attorney Paul F.X. Schwartz appeared by phone means.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Schwartz puts reasons on the record - same as in his email. He played a very insig role in this entire conspiracy. KELLIS: we already tried him in the community twice and he had to come and address violations. This is a serious charge and he's facing a great deal of exposure. Ask the bond remain unchanged. CRT: he was given a cash bond originally, after the COMPASS was done the bond was reduced to $500.00. A capias was issued and he was arrested and given another change on bond and in April  2016 another capias was issued and he was given the chance on JSS and another OTD was issued  6/2016 based on violations. He was incarcerated in July and has been there since. We were prepared to try this b/f the first of the yr. But given the fact that 3 capias were issued, we need to get this matter tried and I don't have confidence that if I give you another chance on EM that you would do any better. Bond is to ensure appearance and I am not sure you will be appearing if a bond is reduced. I will DENY the request.  The CI mtn should be heard sooner rather than later and call my JA to get a date/time for a hearing
Jury trial on February 15, 2017 at 08:45 am.
Motion hearing on February 1, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sam J Lestina in court and in custody  Attorney Paul F.X. Schwartz appeared by phone means. 
SCHWARTZ: warrant out for him for quite some time. I had to schedule some things that conflicted w/ the current trial dates. I absolutely have a conflict w/ the 4th but  not the 2nd or 3rd. One of the issues I have is I currently have 3 trials not including this one. SKEMP: no objection to moving the trial date. 
Any mtns be filed by 1/6 
State to disclose witnesses by 1/13 - Def by  1/20
MH:  2/1 @ 11
JS:  2/13
JT: 2/15-17 (break early for DC on Thursday)

Notice of Bail/Bond forf. to Sharron Lestina. No fwd address
From: Atty Schwartz Re: req BBH hearing
appeared in court

11;00 AM - Def in court.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul F.X. Schwartz appeared by phone means for Defendant Sam J Lestina. Prosecuting Atty John William Kellis appeared for State of Wisconsin.
SCHWARTZ: he's been in constant contact w/ me and staying at the house approved for him. On  1/13/16, as he was leaving his home when his device went off and he called and talked to someone at JSS - they thought he was on house arrest but he told them he was on curfew. Since then he hasn't been able to be monitored.  I assumed everything was taken care of. I didn't see any attempt to get in touch w/ him. If he stays at his present place, he would have to come in a couple times/wk. He's been doing what he's supposed to be doing. KELLIS: the parties are aware of what's expected of them but if there are con't violations or reports that he's not being monitored to revisit this at that point. CRT: will give you the benefit of the doubt today. When there's a violation I have 3 options... QUASH WARRANT (Andrea called to cancel). REINSTATE BOND AND CANCEL THE ORDER FORFEITING BOND - DEF HAS UNTIL THE END OF THE DAY 2/5 TO PROVIDE NEW ADDRESS
